text:
Hi There,

  I am always getting exceptions while running the optional task "JUnitReport" 
(pls. find exceptions attached below)

  I am using Ant v1.5(Apache Ant version 1.5 compiled on July 9 2002) 
on Windows XP (1 GB RAM, 2.4 GHz P4) using JDK 1.4.2_03.

  At the end of my build file, after junit test, we are generating a junit 
test report.

  I have 66 XML files which would be part of the report. If you look at the 
exception details,
it is choking at this line.
"		<redirect:write file="{$output.dir}/{$package.dir}/
{@name}.html">"

How do I go about fixing this problem. Is this a configuration problem ? 

I'll be only too glad to help anyone resolve the problem by providing
other information.

Pls. find below the header information where Ant states the version, 
the OS and VM information, etc

========= END HEADER INFORMATION SNIPPET ==============

Apache Ant version 1.5 compiled on July 9 2002

Pls. find the short snippet of our build.xml below

=========== BEGIN snippet of build.xml ===================
    <target name="-generate.test.report" depends="-init">
        <echo message="**** Generating the jUnit Report at the end ...... 
*****"/>
        <junitreport todir="${account.services}/testreport">
            <fileset dir="${account.services}/testreport">
                <include name="*.xml"/>
            </fileset>
            <report format="frames" 
todir="${account.services}/testreport/html"/>
        </junitreport>
    </target>
=========== END snippet of build.xml ===================

ANJAN BACCHU
creator: anjan.bacchu@summit.fiserv.com

text:
Are you by any chance having an extremely long classpath with lots of '\' ?
If yes, this is a duplicate of 19301, and I'm giving a temporary fix for Xalan 
2.x. See http://issues.apache.org/bugzilla/show_bug.cgi?id=19301
I'm fighting with Xalan 1.x to make it work as well.
creator: sbailliez@apache.org
bodewig@apache.org
text:
Looks like a problem within Xalan.  Could you try a more recent version of Xalan-J
(2.6.0) or JDK 1.5?  In the JDK 1.5 case you must also use Ant 1.6.2 to make it
work - something I'd recommend for this test anyway.

creator: peterreilly@apache.org
text:
Ant 1.7.0 does not support xalan 1, so
Stephane comment #1 would seem to imply
that this is fixed now.

(In reply to comment #3)
> Ant 1.7.0 does not support xalan 1, so
> Stephane comment #1 would seem to imply
> that this is fixed now.

Hi There,

 Either I moved to 1.6.1 or moved to a newer version of Xalan and the problem
went away. As of now, using Ant 1.6.5 and java 1.5.x. So, no issues.

Sorry : I don't remember the exact solution.

BR,
~A
creator: anjan.bacchu@summit.fiserv.com
